claim_cards.claim: In this Planck PR3 CMB lensing workflow, extending metric analysis with morphology-sensitive observables provides an operational advantage for cohort discrimination.
claim_cards.test_hook: Run the same cohort comparison with and without morphology-sensitive diagnostics and compare observed-vs-Gaussian discrimination quality under fixed controls.

source.locator: p1 Abstract; p8 (central claim restatement); p9–10 Conclusion

claim_cards.claim: The strongest and most persistent observed-vs-Gaussian cohort separation appears in the morphology-sensitive diagnostics D1_L2 and Z_mf across lmax ∈ {128, 192, 256, 320}.
claim_cards.test_hook: Recompute D1_L2 and Z_mf across the same lmax sweep using the published pipeline and verify that observed values remain strongly separated from Gaussian control cohort means.

source.note: Decision-block comparison and narrative results sections

claim_cards.claim: On the same morphology-sensitive diagnostics (D1_L2 and Z_mf), the observed cohort remains comparatively close to the ΛCDM reconstruction cohort while remaining far from the Gaussian synthetic controls.
claim_cards.test_hook: Compare observed, Gaussian, and ΛCDM cohort summaries for D1_L2 and Z_mf; verify the qualitative ranking Observed ≈ ΛCDM and both far from Gaussian.

source.locator: p1 Abstract; p3 (role of ΛCDM cohort); p5–8 Results; Table 1 (p7)
source.note: Structured-reference cohort comparison supports morphology-sensitive interpretation

claim_cards.claim: The Gaussian synthetic control cohort is a deliberately strong null: it is power-spectrum-matched to the mean-field-corrected observed reconstruction ((dat-mf) spectrum) while removing higher-order/non-Gaussian morphological organization.
claim_cards.test_hook: Inspect control construction steps and regenerate Gaussian controls from the cleaned harmonic field spectrum; confirm matching at the two-point level while using zero mean field for synthetic runs.

source.note: Gaussian synthetic control construction from phi_clean and C_l estimate

claim_cards.claim: The auxiliary v1 metrics (v1_energy_ratio, v1_peak_shift) act as secondary qualifiers of regime/stability and do not carry the primary observed-vs-Gaussian separation signal in this pipeline.
claim_cards.test_hook: Evaluate cohort separation using only v1_energy_ratio and v1_peak_shift; compare their discriminative consistency to D1_L2 and Z_mf across the same lmax sweep.

source.locator: p4 (Section II.C.2); p5–6 and p8 (Results on auxiliary v1 qualifiers); p9 Conclusion
source.note: Selective separation is concentrated in morphology-sensitive channels

claim_cards.claim: The primary morphology-sensitive separation (D1_L2 and Z_mf) remains stable after expanding the Gaussian cohort to n=40 per lmax and applying Gaussian seed-band cohort hygiene filtering.
claim_cards.test_hook: Repeat aggregation with expanded Gaussian controls and seed-band filtering; verify unchanged qualitative cohort ranking and persistent separation on D1_L2 and Z_mf.

source.locator: p1 Abstract; p4 (cohort hygiene design); p5–6 (expanded cohort + hygiene stability); p8
source.note: Robustness claim against mixed-seed cohort composition artifacts

claim_cards.claim: The results support a conservative interpretation in which morphology-sensitive observables form a complementary 'pre-metric' descriptive layer that extends, but does not replace, standard metric analysis.
claim_cards.test_hook: Test whether the same morphology-sensitive advantage persists across broader null families, alternative reconstructions, and independent replications; failure to reproduce would weaken the interpretation.

source.locator: p2 (definition of pre-metric framing); p8–10 (Discussion and Conclusion)
source.note: Interpretive claim explicitly separated from raw empirical discrimination result

claim_cards.claim: This paper establishes a reproducible, control-based discrimination outcome and methodological claim, but does not establish a new cosmological model or a unique physical mechanism; broader nulls, larger cohorts, and independent replication are required next.
claim_cards.test_hook: Extend the pipeline to additional null families and reconstructions, increase cohort sizes, and perform independent replication; assess whether the reported morphology-sensitive separation persists.

source.locator: p7 (what is and is not established); p9–10 (limitations and next steps)
source.note: Conservative scope boundary and explicit falsification path
